newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danisco 1996 sugar production slightly up.
newsitem.headline: Danisco 1996 sugar production slightly up.

text.p: Danish packaging, drinks, food and sugar producer Danisco A/S on Friday announced total sugar production figures for its Danish, Swedish and German plants slightly higher than in the previous year.
It said it produced a total of 1.046 million tonnes of sugar last year, with Danish production at 503,000 tonnes, Sweden at 397.000 tonnes and Germany at 146,000 tonnes.
The figures compared with 432,414 tonnes for Denmark , 355,961 tonnes for Sweden and 133,931 tonnes for Germany in 1995.
The European Union sugar quotas for 1996 for Danisco in the three territories were 424,629 tonnes for Denmark, 370,000 tonnes for Sweden and 126,565 tonnes for Germany.

Danisco, the fourth biggest sugar producer in Europe, with a virtual monopoly in Denmark and Sweden, attributed its improved 1996 result to a high (18 percent) sugar content in last year's beet harvest.
